alert.note: Alert for Caribou (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 10 at 12:59PM MDT until further notice by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Pocatello ID has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Idaho... Blackfoot River above Blackfoot Reservoir near Henry affecting Caribou County. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/pocatello. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Blackfoot River above Blackfoot Reservoir near Henry. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 5.5 feet, Fields and low-lying areas near the river between Idaho Highway 34 upstream through the Trail Creek and Slug Creek flats to the Blackfoot narrows may experience seep and ponding. The Blackfoot River in some spots may be nearing bankfull. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:45 PM MDT Wednesday the stage was 6.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:45 PM MDT Wednesday was 6.4 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 5.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 6.3 feet on 04/15/2017. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (unknown time) Location Stg Stg Day/Time d1 d2 d3 Blackfoot River Blackfoot Reservoir near Hen 5.5 6.3 Wed 12 pm MD MSG MSG MSG &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
